column4: Does xmms play mp3's in ubuntu ? .. redhat has patched it so that it does not and users are forced to use rhythmbox or other things
yes if you have the mp3 codecs
see this (other redhat "recommended players work great") http://mange.dynalias.org/linux/misc/xmms_redhat_packaged/xmms_redhat_packaged.png
no free linux distros have out of the box mp3 support
i was using linux before most anyone in this channel... im developing it
then I obviously have absolutely no clue what you are talking about?
in that case can you help me with my /etc/network/interfaces file?
Flowking, "no free linux distros have out of the box mp3 support" i know.. redhat patched xmms to not support mp3
youre no coder perhaps.. then i see why youre not getting the lockin
redhat "Use commercial apps or dont listen to mp3's at all"
or no longer free as in free speech right?
not free as in anything dude
speech must always be free (say "shit" on efnets linux channel, for each iteration youll be banned *2 weeks :P)
